languages: telepathy 120 ft. with all aquatic creatures

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The warlock's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma. It can innately cast the following spells (spell save {@dc 20}), requiring no material components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The warlock is a 14th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 20}, {@hit 12} to hit with spell attacks). It regains its expended spell slots when it finishes a short or long rest. It knows the following warlock spells:

action.name: Multishoot
entries: Abigail can use Kraken Blast three times and can use Grasp of the Deep.

action.name: Kraken Blast
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 12} to hit, range 300 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) force damage and the target is pushed 10ft the the opposite direction and its speed is reduced by 10ft until the start of her next turn

action.name: Grasp of the Deep - bonus action
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d10}) cold or lightning damage.

action.name: Devouring Maw
entries: Abigail chooses a point She can see within 60 feet of her. For 1 minute, a translucent maw manifests in a 10-foot radius centered on that point. Each creature in that area when the maw appears must succeed on a {@dc 20} Strength saving throw be {@condition restrained}. Any creature that starts its turn in the maw's area takes {@damage 3d6} cold or lightning damage. As an action, a {@condition restrained} creature can repeat the saving throw, ending the restraint on a success. At the start of Abigail's turn, if there is a creature in the maw's area, she gain 14 temporary hit points.

action.name: Unleash the Depths
entries: Transport: You and up to five willing creatures of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of the manifestation point are grasped by spectral tentacles and yanked through your patron's realm. The tentacles teleport you and the chosen creatures to a point of your choice within 100 miles that you have visited within the past 24 hours. The tentacles then vanish.

Fury: You can direct a barrage of spectral tentacles to issue forth and strike up to five creatures you can see within 30 feet of the manifestation point. Each target must make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 6d10} cold or lightning damage (your choice) and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and is not knocked {@condition prone}. The tentacles then vanish.

reaction.name: Guardian Grasp
entries: When Abigail or a creature she can see takes damage while within 10 feet of her Grasp of the Deep tentacle, she can use her reaction to choose one of those creatures and reduce the damage to the chosen creature by half. After doing so, the Grasp of the Deep tentacle vanishes.

fluff.name: Warlock of the Great Old One

entries: Warlocks of the Great Old One gain their powers through magical pacts forged with eldritch entities from strange and distant realms of existence. Some of these warlocks associate with cultists devoted to these entities, as well as aberrations that share their goals, yet other warlocks of the Great Old One are experts at rooting out the insanity and wickedness inspired by bizarre beings from beyond the stars.

monster.name: Akar Kessell
languages: the languages it knew in life

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The wight's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 12}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no verbal or material components:

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the wight has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wight attacks twice with Grave Bolt.

action.name: Grave Bolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 4} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Life Drain
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

A humanoid slain by this attack rises 24 hours later as a {@creature zombie} under the wight's control, unless the humanoid is restored to life or its body is destroyed. The wight can have no more than twelve {@creature zombie||zombies} under its control at one time.

entries.name: Deathlock Wight
entries: Bereft of much of its magic, a deathlock wight lingers between the warlock it was and the deathly existence of a wight—a special punishment meted out by certain patrons and necromancers.

entries.name: Deathlock
entries: The forging of a pact between a warlock and a patron is no minor occasion—at least not for the warlock. The consequences of breaking that pact can be dire and, in some cases, lethal. A warlock who fails to live up to a bargain with an evil patron runs the risk of rising from the dead as a deathlock, a foul undead driven to serve its otherworldly patron from beyond the grave.
An extraordinarily powerful necromancer might also discover the dark methods of creating a deathlock and then bind it to service, acting in this respect as the deathlock's patron.

entries.name: Obedient and Obsessed
entries: An overpowering urge to serve consumes the mind of a newly awakened deathlock. All goals and ambitions it had in life that don't please its patron fall away as its master's desires become the purpose that drives the deathlock.

The creature immediately resumes work on its patron's behalf. Accomplishing a difficult goal might mean the deathlock is forced to serve another powerful creature or might entail in gathering servants of its own.

Whatever the goal, it always reflects the patron's interests, ranging from small-scale concerns to matters of cosmic scope. A deathlock in the thrall of a fiend might work to destroy a specific temple dedicated to a good god, while one that serves a Great Old One could be charged with hunting for the materials needed to call forth a horrifying entity into the world.

entries.name: Undead Nature
entries: A deathlock doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

spellcasting.name: Shadow Arts
headerEntries: As an action, the angel can spend 2 ki points to cast the following spells.

trait.name: Poisoned Claws
entries: If the angel can use its action to poison its claws.
The first six attack deals an aditional poison damage based on the poison.
{@item Serpent Venom} - 10 ({@damage 3d6}) {@dc 11}
{@item Wyvern Poison} - 24 ({@damage 7d6}) {@dc 15}
{@item Purple Worm Poison} 42 ({@damage 12d6}) {@dc 19}

trait.name: Magic items
entries: The angel has the following magic items:
Hell Crown ; {@item Insignia of Claws | HotDQ}; {@item Ring of protection}; {@item Cloak of Elvenkind}

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the angel is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the angel instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Stillness of Mind
entries: The angel can use an action to end one effect on itself that is causing it to be {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the angel moves at least 10 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with its an attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 10 ({@damage 2d10}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Ki (17/day)
entries: The angel can use one of the following as a bonus action using 1 ki point:
Flurry of Blows - Attack
Patient Defense - Dodge
Step of the Wind - Disengage or Dash

trait.name: Touch of Death (3ki)
entries: When you hit a creature with an unarmed strike, you can spend 3 ki points to start these imperceptible vibrations, which last for a number of days equal to your monk level. The vibrations are harmless unless you use your action to end them. To do so, you and the target must be on the same plane of existence. When you use this action, the creature must make a Constitution saving throw of {@dc 19}. If it fails, it is reduced to 0 hit points. If it succeeds, it takes {@damage 10d10} necrotic damage.

trait.name: Shadow Step
entries: When the angel is in dim light or darkness, as a bonus action he can teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space he can see that is also in dim light or darkness. He then have advantage on the first melee attack he make before the end of the turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The angel makes two attacks and can make one Unarmed Strike as a bonus action or two if it uses 1 ki .

action.name: Unarmed Strike +1
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 1d10 + 6}) slashing damage. This is a magic weapon attack. The angel can spend 1 ki point to attempt a stunning strike. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw of {@dc 19} or be {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Cloak of Shadows
entries: When the angel is in an area of dim light or darkness, it can become {@condition invisible}. It remains {@condition invisible} until it makes an attack, casts a spell, or is in an area of bright light.

reaction.name: Deflect Missiles
entries: The angel can reduce the damage taken by any ranged attack that it can see incoming. When it does so, the damage it takes from the attack is reduced by {@dice 1d10 + 22}. If it is reduced to 0, it can make a ranged attack with the projectile (range 20/60 feet).

senses: blindsight 60 ft. blind beyond this range,

trait.name: Ice Walk
entries: The dragon can move across and climb icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. Additionally, {@quickref difficult terrain||3} composed of ice or snow doesn't cost it extra movement.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragon can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 3d10 + 8}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) cold damage.

action.name: Claw

action.name: Tail

If the creature is large or smaller it is also pushed 20 feet in a direction chosen by the dragon.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the dragon's choice that is within 120 feet of the dragon and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Cold Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The dragon exhales an icy blast in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 22} Constitution saving throw, taking 72 ({@damage 16d8}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The dragon makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
entries: The dragon makes a tail attack.

legendary.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The dragon beats its wings. Each creature within 15 feet of the dragon must succeed on a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw or take 18 ({@damage 3d6 + 8}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. The dragon can then fly up to half its flying speed.

Arveiaturace the White Wyrm, known to sailors and minstrels alike as Iceclaws, thanks to her habit of drifting low over ships sailing off the Sword Coast and plucking up crew members for quick snacks. This ancient white dragon is feared by all sailors who ply the shipping lanes of the Sword Coast, except for those who dismiss her as a legend -- until it's too late. The Flying Hunt of Nimbral and several aerial patrols from Evermeet have fought her in midair and forced her into flight on occasion, but most ships are helpless against her diving attacks -- and when crews scramble down into their holds to escape her snatching claws, she's been known to land on a ship and tear it apart like a child opening a gift. What makes Arveiaturace so deadly is she is the steed of a wizard, Meltharond Thone, who captured and tamed her centuries ago.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Avarice is a 10th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}; {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). She has knows the following sorcerer and warlock spells:

trait.name: Icy Doom
entries: When Avarice dies, her corpse freezes for 9 days, during which time it can't be thawed, harmed by fire, animated, or raised from the dead.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Avarice wields a {@item staff of frost} with 10 charges, a {@item Spell Gem (Star ruby) | OotA}

trait.name: Spell Sniper
entries: When Avarice casts a spell that requires her to make an attack roll, the spell's range is doubled, additionally her ranged spell attacks ignore half cover and three-quarters cover.

action.name: Twin Rays
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 8} to hit, range 120 ft., up to two targets. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d8}) cold damage and the target's speed is decreased by 10 feet until the end of it's next turn.

action.name: Twin Bolts
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 8} to hit, range 240 ft., up to two targets. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d10}) fire damage.

action.name: Staff of Frost
entries: While holding this staff, Avarice can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it (spell save {@dc 16}): {@spell cone of cold} (5 charges), {@spell fog cloud} (1 charge), {@spell ice storm} (4 charges), or {@spell wall of ice} (4 charges). The staff regains {@dice 1d6 + 4} charges daily at dawn. If its last charge is expended, roll a {@dice d20}; on a 1, the staff turns to water and is destroyed.

bonus.name: Quickened Spell
entries: Avarice casts a spell that has a casting time of one action as a bonus action.

reaction.name: Banishing Rebuke (Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries: When Avarice is damaged by a creature that she can see within 60 feet of her, she can banish that creature to a frigid extradimensional prison for 1 minute. While there, the creature is {@condition incapacitated} and takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) cold damage at the start of each of its turns. At the end of each of its turns, the creature can make a {@dc 16} Charisma saving throw, escaping the prison on a success and reappearing in the space it left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied. A creature that dies in the prison is trapped there indefinitely.

Avarice is a cruel and vindictive tiefling trained in the arcane tradition of evocation. She likes using her magic to destroy things, and her hunger for magic items knows no bounds. Her supreme confidence means that she never backs down from a challenge, even when the odds are clearly stacked against her. Seeing other wizards as a threat, paranoia rules her life.

Avarice has been a member of the Arcane Brotherhood for almost two years. She fantasizes about rising to fame and prominence in record time and hopes that plundering the lost Netherese city of Ythryn will turn her fantasies into reality.

The tiefling has the secret support of the archdevil Levistus, having traded her soul years ago for her first taste of magical power. Levistus speaks to her in dreams and guides her path. Shortly after Avarice arrived in Ten-Towns, Levistus urged her to seek out the Black Sword. Avarice didn't know who or what the Black Sword was until she was approached by cultists of Levistus bearing swordlike shards of chardalyn worn as pendants around their necks. These self-styled Knights of the Black Sword offered her sanctuary in the keep of Caer-Dineval, where they are based. Although she doesn't trust the cultists, they treat her with more respect than anyone else does, and the keep is a safer location than most other places in Ten-Towns.

entries.name: Companions
entries: Avarice has a pair of loyal {@creature Gargoyle||gargoyles} named Gargle and Gurgle who serve her as bodyguards and scouts. Avarice uses her {@spell Rary's telepathic bond} spell to stay in telepathic contact with her gargoyles before sending them off on any mission. Avarice also has the support of the Knights of the Black Sword, if she needs to call on their talents.

entries.name: Familiar
entries: Avarice's familiar throughout the adventure is a squawking raven named Skelm. It uses the {@creature raven} stat block in the {@book Monster Manual|MM} but is a fiend instead of a beast.

entries.name: Spellbook
entries: Avarice's spellbook has white leather covers and vellum pages. The tiefling's personal sigil is burned into the front cover. The book contains the spells Avarice has prepared plus the following additional spells: {@spell burning hands}, {@spell cone of cold}, {@spell find familiar}, {@spell ice storm}, {@spell lightning bolt}, {@spell rope trick}, {@spell thunderwave}, {@spell tongues}, {@spell wall of fire}, and {@spell wall of force}.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: Blackblood can use its action to polymorph into a wolf-humanoid hybrid or into a direwolf or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its AC, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The wolfwere has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The wolfwere has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the wolfwere's allies is within 5 ft. of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: Blackblood regains 30 hit points at the start of its turn. If Blackblood takes radiant or necrotic damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the blackblood's next turn. Blackblood dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Corrupting Touch
entries: When Blackblood scores a critical hit or starts its turn with a foe {@condition grappled}, it can dissolve one leather, metal, or wood item of its choosing in the possession of the target creature. A mundane item is destroyed automatically; a magical item is destroyed if its owner fails to make a successful {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw.

action.name: Multiattack (Hybrid form only)
entries: Blackblood makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Multiattack (Humanoid form only)
entries: Blackblood makes two weapon attacks.

action.name: Longsword (Humanoid form only)

action.name: Bite (Wolf or Hybrid form only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) piercing damage, plus 10 ({@damage 4d4}) acid damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). Until this grapple ends, Blackblood can't bite another target.

action.name: Claws (Hybrid form only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) slashing damage, plus 10 ({@damage 4d4}) acid damage.

action.name: Blood Curdling Howl (1/day)
entries: Blackblood lets out a horrific howl. Every humanoid within 200 ft. of Blackblood that can hear the howl must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be {@spell slow||slowed} for 10 minutes. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the effect ends on it. A target that successfully saves is immune to Blackblood's howl for the next 24 hours.

reaction.name: Sloughing Corruption
entries: When Blackblood is subjected to lightning or slashing damage, it spawns a Black Corruption if it has the Regeneration ability. Using this ability reduces the amount Blackblood regenerates permanently by 10 disabling the ability when it is reduced to 0.

trait.name: Etehernal Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d12 + 4}) slashing damage.

bonus.name: Mighty Swing
entries: The zombie slowly raises its weapon for a wide swing, choosing a 15-foot cube originating from itself. At the start of its next turn, the zombie uses its action to make an attack against all creatures in the area that are not {@condition prone}. If the zombie moves or is moved the area moves with it.

From somewhere in the darkness, a gurgling moan is heard. A form lurches into view, dragging one foot as it raises bloated arms and broken hands. The zombie advances, driven to kill anyone too slow to escape its grasp.

entries.name: Dark Servants
entries: Sinister necromantic magic infuses the remains of the dead, causing them to rise as zombies that do their creator's bidding without fear or hesitation. They move with a jerky, uneven gait, clad in the moldering apparel they wore when put to rest, and carrying the stench of decay.

Most zombies are made from humanoid remains, though the flesh and bones of any formerly living creature can be imbued with a semblance of life. Necromantic magic, usually from spells, animates a zombie. Some zombies rise spontaneously when dark magic saturates an area. Once turned into a zombie, a creature can't be restored to life except by powerful magic, such as a {@spell resurrection} spell.

A zombie retains no vestiges of its former self, its mind devoid of thought and imagination. A zombie left without orders simply stands in place and rots unless something comes along that it can kill. The magic animating a zombie imbues it with evil, so left without purpose, it attacks any living creature it encounters.

entries.name: Hideous Forms
entries: Zombies appear as they did in life, showing the wounds that killed them. However, the magic that creates these vile creatures often takes time to run its course. Dead warriors might rise from a battlefield, eviscerated and bloated after days in the sun. The muddy cadaver of a peasant could claw its way from the ground, riddled with maggots and worms. A zombie might wash ashore or rise from a marsh, swollen and reeking after weeks in the water.

entries.name: Mindless Soldiers
entries: Zombies take the most direct route to any foe, unable to comprehend obstacles, tactics, or dangerous terrain. A zombie might stumble into a fast-flowing river to reach foes on a far shore, clawing at the surface as it is battered against rocks and destroyed. To reach a foe below it, a zombie might step out of an open window. Zombies stumble through roaring infernos, into pools of acid, and across fields littered with caltrops without hesitation.

A zombie can follow simple orders and distinguish friends from foes, but its ability to reason is limited to shambling in whatever direction it is pointed, pummeling any enemy in its path. A zombie armed with a weapon uses it, but the zombie won't retrieve a dropped weapon or other tool until told to do so.

entries.name: Undead Nature
entries: A zombie doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: While its master lives, a destroyed boneclaw gains a new body in {@dice 1d6} hours, with all its hit points. The new body appears within 1 mile of the boneclaw's master.

trait.name: Shadow Stealth
entries: While in dim light or darkness, the boneclaw can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

trait.name: Adamantine Claw

- a Constitution saving throw or lose its reaction for the turn.
- a Dexterity saving throw or fall {@condition prone}.
- a Strength saving throw or drop one item it is holding.

trait.name: Armour of Silence
entries: The boneclaw wields a {@item +2 plate armor} that creates a 10 feet radius area centered around the creature that has the {@spell silence} effect.

trait.name: Body transporter
entries: If the boneclaw dies its body instantly teleports to his master.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The boneclaw makes two claw attacks and can make two adamantine claw attacks as a bonus action (or the other way around)

action.name: Piercing Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d10 + 5}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, the boneclaw can pull the target up to 10 feet toward itself, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 19}). The boneclaw has one claw. While a claw grapples a target, the claw can attack only that target.

action.name: Shadow Jump
entries: If the boneclaw is in dim light or darkness, each creature of the boneclaw's choice within 5 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw or take 34 ({@damage 5d12}) necrotic damage.

The boneclaw then magically teleports up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. It can bring one creature it's grappling, teleporting that creature to an unoccupied space it can see within 5 feet of its destination. The destination spaces of this teleportation must be in dim light or darkness.

action.name: Adamantine Claw +2
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 3d10 + 7}) slashing damage.

reaction.name: Deadly Reach
entries: In response to a visible enemy moving in its reach or casting a spell, the boneclaw makes one claw attack against that enemy. If the attack hits, the boneclaw can make a second claw attack against the target.

mythic.name: Snuff out
entries: The boneclaw snuffs out all light sources and dispels all ongoing spell effects ({@spell Dispel Magic}) that emanate light within 120 feet of itself. And summon a {@creature Shadow} for every living humanoid that is within the radius of this effect. The {@creature Shadow}s immediately attack their humanoid counterpart and disappear it the humanoid dies.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: Cirlia has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put him to sleep.

Personality: Cirlia Salinde is a very shy but kind hearted person who is always willing to help others. She is very loyal to those she loves and respects. She can be unpatient at times but always refrains herself from doing something dangerous or dumb.
Appearance: Cirlia Salinde is a young female High elf with green short hair with two smaller ponytail like strands at the back of her head.

trait.name: Devour
entries: While swallowed, the creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the naga, and it takes 20 ({@damage 8d4}) acid damage at the start of each of the naga's turns.

If the naga takes 20 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the naga must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the naga. If the naga dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 30 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Chromatic Guardians
entries: The Chromatic Nagas are always found in groups, each one possesses a unique elemental affinity. Each Naga also has a vulnerability to one of the damage types of another Naga. A chromatic naga is immune to its element and gives damage resistance to the associated damage type for all other allied nagas, negating the damage vulnerability of its counterpart naga.

Each naga has access to a different bite attack and spells, associated with the element it represents. When a naga loses the protection againts the damage type it is vulnerable to, it gains access to a a more powerful spell and all it's attacks deal an additional {@dice 2d8} of its associated damage type.

action.name: Poisonous Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage and 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage. Additionally, the target must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw, or be {@condition poisoned} until the end of the naga's next turn.

action.name: Devouring Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage and 9 ({@damage 2d8}) acid damage. If the target is a creature it is also {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). Until this grapple ends the naga can't bite another target and if it hits the {@condition grappled} creature a second time the naga swallows the creature.

action.name: Immolating Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage and 9 ({@damage 2d8}) fire damage. If the target is a creature or a flammable object, it ignites. Until a creature takes an action to douse the fire, the target takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

action.name: Illuminating Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage and 9 ({@damage 2d8}) radiant damage. Additionally, the next attack roll made against this target before the end of the naga's next turn has advantage, thanks to the mystical dim light glittering on the target until then.

action.name: Killing Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage and 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage. Additionally, the target can't regain hit points until the start of the naga's next turn.

action.name: Thunderous Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage and 9 ({@damage 2d8}) lightning damage. Additionally, the target must make a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw, or be knocked back 15 feet.

fluff.name: Guardian Naga
entries: Wise and good, the beautiful guardian nagas protect sacred places and items of magical power from falling into evil hands. In their hidden redoubts, they research spells and hatch convoluted plots to thwart the evil designs of their enemies.
A guardian naga doesn't seek out violence, warning off intruders rather than attacking. Only if its foes persist does the naga attack, accosting enemies with its spells and poisonous spittle.

entries.name: Nagas
entries: Nagas are intelligent serpents that inhabit the ruins of the past, amassing arcane treasures and knowledge.

The first nagas were created as immortal guardians by a humanoid race long lost to history. When this race died out, the nagas deemed themselves the rightful inheritors of their masters' treasures and magical lore. Industrious and driven, nagas occasionally venture out from their lairs to track down magic items or rare spellbooks.
Nagas never feel the ravages of time or succumb to sickness. Even if it is struck down, a naga's immortal spirit reforms in a new body in a matter of days, ready to continue its eternal work.

entries.name: Benevolent Dictators and Brutal Tyrants
entries: A naga rules its domain with absolute authority. Whether it rules with compassion or by terrorizing its subjects, the naga believes itself the master of all other creatures that inhabit its domain.

entries.name: Rivalry
entries: Nagas have a long-standing enmity with the yuan-ti, with each race seeing itself as the epitome of serpentine evolution. Though cooperation between them is rare, nagas and yuan-ti sometimes set aside their differences to work toward common objectives. However, yuan-ti always chafe under a naga's authority.

entries.name: Immortal Nature
entries: A naga doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Dendar's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 24}). Dendar can innately cast the following spells, requiring no somatic or material components or concentration.

trait.name: Gaze Uppon the End
entries: When a creature that can see The Night Serpent starts its turn, Dendar can force it to make a {@dc 24} Wisdom saving throw. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is instantly {@condition paralyzed}. Otherwise, a creature that fails the save is {@condition frightend}. The {@condition frightend} creature must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn, becoming {@condition paralyzed} on a failure or ending the effect on a success.

Unless {@quickref Surprise|PHB|3|0|surprised}, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can't see the Night Serpent until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at The Night Serpent in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.

trait.name: Astral Entity
entries: The Night Serpent can't leave the Astral Plane, nor can it be banished or otherwise transported out of that plane.

trait.name: Nightmarish Demiple
entries: Anything The Night Serpent devours is transported to a demiplane that can be entered by no other means except a {@spell wish} spell or The Night Serpent's Devour and Glimse of Doom. A creature can leave the demiplane only by using magic that enables planar travel, such as the {@spell plane shift} spell. Like a stomach, it contains the remains of past meals. The The Night Serpent can't be harmed from within the demiplane. If The Night Serpent dies, the demiplane disappears, and everything inside it appears around The Night Serpent's corpse. The demiplane is otherwise indestructible.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If The Night Serpent fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Sever Silver Cord
entries: If The Night Serpent scores a critical hit against a creature travelling by means of the {@spell astral projection} spell, The Night Serpent can cut the target's silver cord instead of dealing damage.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The Night Serpent doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Living Darkness
entries: While in dim light or darkness, The Night Serpent is immune to damage that isn't force, psychic, or radiant

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Night Sepent makes three two Forked Tongue and one Devour

action.name: Devour
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}49 ({@damage 6d12 + 20}) force damage. If the target is a creature and this damage reduces it to 0 hit points or it is {@condition incapacitated}, The Night Serpent swallows it. The swallowed target, along with everything it is wearing and carrying, appears in an unoccupied space in a Nightmarish Demiple.

action.name: Forked Tongue
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d6 + 10}) bludgeoning damage, plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage.

legendary.name: Wispers of the Night
entries: The Night Serpent uses its spellcasting ability or uses a devoured creature's abilities as her own.

legendary.name: Glimse of Doom
entries: One creature that The Night Serpent can see within 60 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 24} Charisma saving throw or be teleported to an unoccupied space in Dendar's Nightmarish Demiple. At the end of the target's next turn, it reappears in the space it left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.

legendary.name: Mind Venom (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Each creature within 60 feet of The Night Serpent must make a {@dc 24} Wisdom saving throw, taking 40 ({@damage 6d10 + 7}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
Lair Actions:
Regurgitate Horrors.

The Night Serpent's maw opens agape and horrors it has consumed pour out. Two creatures trapped in her Nightmarish Demiple appear in unoccupied spaces 10 feet in front of The Night Serpent. They immediately take their turns.
Crushing Body.

A creature within 120 feet of Dendar must succeed on a DC 20 Dexterity saving throw or take 55 (10d10) bludgeoning damage and become restrained and fall prone as The Night Serpents' immense body crushes the creature. On a successful save a creature takes half damage and is not restrained and does not fall prone.
Unseen End.

The Night Serpent snuffs all magical and non-magical light within a mile of itself. Spells that shed light lower than 6th level are dispelled while higher level spells and effects of magic items that shed light are suppressed until the next initiative count 20.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Felgolos is a 16th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 21}, {@hit 13} to hit with spell attacks). Felgolos knows the following spells:

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: Felgolos can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Felgolos fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Thongameir's Master Spell
entries: This powerful, enduring spell was cast upon Felgolos by the archmage Thongameir. It has three effects; all three function only against effects that are subject to spell resistance. If the attack is one that affects multiple creatures, other creatures are affected normally and Felgolos is unharmed (Thongameir's magic doesn't protect anyone other than Felgolos himself). Like actual spell resistance, Felgolos can suppress this ability when he wants to accept certain spells.

All Enchantment effects that would affect at Felgolos have no effect other than to cure a number of hit points equal to one point per spell level of the magical attack. Hit points in excess of his normal total remain for one day as temporary hit points. Successive enchantment effects simply cure more hit points or give him more temporary hit points. Effects without a spell level do not give him hit points but still do not affect him.

All Necromancy magics cast at Felgolos have no effect other than to give him a limited fast healing ability for one day, restoring hit points per hour equal to 1 hit point per spell level of the necromantic attack. This effect has brought the dragon back from apparent death more than once. Multiple Necromancy effects do not stack; he gains the most favorable rate of limited fast healing from the attacks directed against him (so if struck with a 9th-level Necromancy spell and a 1st-level Necromancy spell, Felgolos heals 9 hit points per hour for the next day). Effects without a spell level do not give him fast healing but still do not otherwise affect him.

All Transmutation magics of 5th-level or higher cast at Felgolos have no effect except to allow the dragon to cast a single teleport spell at any time within the next day. Multiple Transmutation effects give him multiple uses of this teleport spell, each with its own time of expiration. Transmutation effects of less than 5th level have no effect whatsoever, but do not give him the ability to use teleport.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Felgolos can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of Felgolos's choice that is within 120 feet of Felgolos and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to Felgolos's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Breath Weapons {@recharge 5}
entries: Felgolos uses one of the following breath weapons.

items.name: Lightning Breath
items.entry: Felgolos exhales lightning in a 90-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw, taking 66 ({@damage 12d10}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Repulsion Breath
items.entry: Felgolos exhales repulsion energy in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is pushed 60 feet away from Felgolos.

action.name: Change Shape
entries: Felgolos magically polymorphs into a humanoid or beast that has a challenge rating no higher than its own, or back into its true form. It reverts to its true form if it dies. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (Felgolos's choice).

In a new form, Felgolos retains its alignment, hit points, Hit Dice, ability to speak, proficiencies, Legendary Resistance, lair actions, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores, as well as this action. Its statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features or legendary actions of that form.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: Felgolos makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
entries: Felgolos makes a tail attack.

legendary.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Felgolos beats its wings. Each creature within 10 feet of Felgolos must succeed on a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw or take 13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. Felgolos can then fly up to half its flying speed.
Art made by madnessdemon.
https://www.deviantart.com/madnessdemon/art/Bronze-dragon-922464373

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The revenant regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the revenant takes fire or radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the revenant's next turn. The revenant's body is destroyed only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: When the revenant's body is destroyed, its soul lingers. After 24 hours, the soul inhabits and animates another humanoid corpse on the same plane of existence and regains all its hit points. While the soul is bodiless, a {@spell wish} spell can be used to force the soul to go to the afterlife and not return.

trait.name: Turn Immunity
entries: The revenant is immune to effects that turn undead.

trait.name: Vengeful Tracker
entries: The revenant knows the distance to and direction of any creature against which it seeks revenge, even if the creature and the revenant are on different planes of existence. If the creature being tracked by the revenant dies, the revenant knows. When the revenant hits a creature that it has sworn vengeance against, the target takes an extra 14 ({@damage 4d6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The revenant makes two attacks.

action.name: Revenant Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 3d4 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Vengeful Glare
entries: The revenant targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it and against which it has sworn vengeance. The target must make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the target is {@condition paralyzed} until the revenant deals damage to it, or until the end of the revenant's next turn. When the paralysis ends, the target is {@condition frightened} of the revenant for 1 minute. The {@condition frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if it can see the revenant, ending the {@condition frightened} condition on itself on a success.

action.name: Leadership (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: For 1 minute, the revenant can utter a special command or warning whenever a nonhostile creature that it can see within 30 feet of it makes an attack roll or a saving throw. The creature can add a {@dice d4} to its roll provided it can hear and understand the knight. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if the revenant is {@condition incapacitated}.

bonus.name: Quick Slash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d4 + 5}) slashing damage.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The revenant adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the revenant must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

A revenant forms from the soul of a mortal who met a cruel and undeserving fate. It claws its way back into the world to seek revenge against the one who wronged it. The revenant reclaims its mortal body and superficially resembles a zombie. However, instead of lifeless eyes, a revenant's eyes burn with resolve and flare in the presence of its adversary. If the revenant's original body was destroyed or is otherwise unavailable, the spirit of the revenant enters another humanoid corpse. Regardless of the body the revenant uses as a vessel, its adversary always recognizes the revenant for what it truly is.

entries.name: Hunger for Revenge
entries: A revenant has only one year to exact revenge. When its adversary dies, or if the revenant fails to kill its adversary before its time runs out, it crumbles to dust and its soul fades into the afterlife. If its foe is too powerful for the revenant to destroy on its own, it seeks worthy allies to help it fulfill its quest.

entries.name: Divine Justice
entries: No magic can hide a creature pursued by a revenant, which always knows the direction and distance between it and the target of its vengeance. In cases where the revenant seeks revenge against more than one adversary, it pursues them one at a time, starting with the creature that dealt it the killing blow. If the revenant's body is destroyed, its soul flies forth to seek out a new corpse in which to resume its hunt.

entries.name: Undead Nature
entries: A revenant doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Flesh is a spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). It regains its expended spell slots when it finishes a short or long rest. It knows the following spells:

trait.name: Apotheonic Rejuvenation
entries: When Flesh of the Deep drops to 0 hit points, its body dies and cracks open like a cocoon. Zik instantly emerges from the cocoon in his third form, Twice Borrn, in the space where his previous form died. His initiative changes to be right after the current combatant.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If Flesh fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Flesh makes two attacks, but only one of them can be a feed attack.

action.name: Eldrich Limbs
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage, and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 12}). The Flesh has four limbs, each of which can grapple one target. When the flesh hits a creature it already {@condition grappled} it can {@condition restrained} the target using two limbs.

action.name: Eldrich Blast
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 7} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) damage and the flesh can move the target 10 feet in any direction of its choosing.

action.name: Feed
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one {@condition grappled} or {@condition restrained} target. {@h}8 ({@damage 3d4 + 1}) slashing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) acid damage, and the flesh recovers hit points equal to the acid damage dealt.

reaction.name: Eldrich Barrier
entries: If the flesh sees an attack targeting it, it can form a shield out of its limbs, adding 9 to its AC until the end of its next round and dropping anything it is holding. While the shield is active the flesh can't use any of its limbs to attack or cast spells and its movement speed is reduced by 10 feet.

reaction.name: Tip the Balance
entries: If the Flesh fails a saving throw or is hit with an attack, he can choose to reroll the save or the attack and let out a horrible reality-altering scream. Until the end of its next turn, all saving throws and attacks it makes are made with advantage, and all creatures that it can see suffer a disadvantage on all attacks and saving throws. However, if the flesh takes 10 or more damage from a single source of damage it it must make a Wisdom saving throw with a DC equal to half the damage sustained. On a failed save the flesh becomes {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

legendary.name: Eldrich Grasp
entries: The Flesh makes one attack with Eldrich Limbs or Eldrich Blast.

legendary.name: Mutated Spells (costs 2 actions)
entries: The Flesh casts a spell without needing to provide any components for the spell or if the spell is a cantrip that would target a single creature it can choose to target two instead.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The jester's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells requiring no components:

trait.name: Last Laugh
entries: Unless it is destroyed in a manner amusing to the god of death that created it, the grim jester is brought back after {@dice 1d20} minutes in a place of the god's choosing with full health.

trait.name: Mock the Dying
entries: Death saving throws made within 60 feet of the jester have disadvantage.

trait.name: Turn Resistance
entries: The jester has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

trait.name: Suave Defense
entries: While the jester is wearing light or no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Charisma modifier.

action.name: Killing Joke (1/day)
entries: The jester performs an ancient, nihilistic joke of necromantic power. This joke has no effect on undead or constructs. All other creatures within 60 feet of the jester must make a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw. Those that fail fall {@condition prone} in a fit of deadly laughter. The laughter lasts {@dice 1d4} rounds, during which time the victim is can't talk or cast spells requiring verbal components. At the end of its turn each round, an {@condition incapacitated} victim must make a successful {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or gain one level of {@condition exhaustion}.

action.name: Joker's Shuffle {@recharge 6}
entries: The jester forces one Medium or Small humanoid within 60 feet to make a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw. If the saving throw fails, the jester and the target exchange locations via teleportation and an illusion causes them to swap appearance: the jester looks and sounds like the target, and the target looks and sounds like the jester. The illusion lasts for 1 hour unless it is dismissed earlier by the jester as a bonus action, or dispelled ({@dc 15}).

reaction.name: Ridicule Hope {@recharge 4}
entries: When a spell that restores hit points is cast within 60 feet of the jester, the jester can cause that spell to inflict damage instead of curing it. The damage equals the hit points the spell would have cured.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The jester's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 18}, {@hit 10} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells requiring no components:

trait.name: Last Laugh
entries: If it has a phylactery, the destroyed jester gains a new body in {@dice 1d10} days, regaining all its hit points and becoming active again. The new body appears within 5 feet of the phylactery.

trait.name: Turn Resistance
entries: The jester has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

reaction.name: Ridicule Hope
entries: When a spell that restores hit points is cast within 60 feet of the jester, the jester can cause that spell to inflict damage instead of curing it. The damage equals the hit points the spell would have cured.

reaction.name: Joker's Shuffle
entries: If the jester is a target for an attack roll it can force one Medium or Small humanoid within 60 feet to make a {@dc 18} Charisma saving throw. If the saving throw fails, the jester and the target exchange locations via teleportation and an illusion causes them to swap appearance: the jester looks and sounds like the target, and the target looks and sounds like the jester. The illusion lasts for 1 hour unless it is dismissed earlier by the jester as a bonus action, or dispelled ({@dc 18}).

mythic.name: Mock The Dead - Original
entries: If the jester sees any creature that is not a zombie or skeleton, die it performs an ancient, nihilistic joke of necromantic power. This joke has no effect on undead or constructs. All other creatures within 60 feet of the jester must make a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw. Those that fail fall {@condition prone} in a fit of deadly laughter. The laughter lasts {@dice 1d4} rounds, during which time the victim is {@condition incapacitated} and unable to stand up from {@condition prone}. At the end of its turn each round, an {@condition incapacitated} victim must make a successful {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be reduced to 0 hit points. The laughter can be ended early by rendering the victim {@condition unconscious} or with greater restoration or comparable magic.

mythic.name: Mock The Dead - Bardic
entries: If the jester sees any creature that is not a zombie or skeleton, die it performs an ancient, nihilistic joke of necromantic power. All other undead creatures within 60 feet of the jester gains a {@dice d10} bardic inspiration. If the creature adds that dice to an attack it can attack the rolled number to the damage to as well.

monster.name: Harkon Lukas

walk.condition: (40 ft. in hybrid form, 50 ft. in dire wolf form)

languages: any three languages (can't speak in wolf form)

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Humanoid Form Only)
headerEntries: The bard casts one of the following spells using Charisma as its spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 18}):

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: The loup garou has advantage on attack rolls against a creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: When the loup garou fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Regeneration (20/Day)
entries: The loup garou regains 15 hit points at the start of its turn using one of its hit die. If the loup garou takes damage from a silver weapon, this trait doesn't function at the start of the loup garou's next turn. The loup garou dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Weaknesses
entries: The loup garou has the following flaws:

{@i Fear of Silver.} When the loup garou sees silver it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} of it. The loup garou can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If the effect ends for it, the loup garou is immune to this weakness for the next hour.

{@i Infatuated with Songs.} At the start of its turn when the loup garo hears a song being played it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw with the DC being the performance skill check of the one playing the instrument or singing or become {@condition incapacitated} until the beginning of its next turn or until the music stops. If the music is not played or sung by a performer but is an illusion, mimicry or a construct playing music, the DC is instead an 8.

{@i Cyclical Nature.} The loup garo is immune to all effects that would force it to shapeshift like a moonbeam however, the loup garou is forced to transform into a humanoid form when the sun rises after a full moon and forced into a dire wolf form when the sun sets at a new moon. The loup garou is unable to shift to its other forms until the sun sets after a full moon or until the sun rises after a new moon.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The loup garou makes two attacks: two with its Longsword (humanoid form) or one with its Bite and one with its Claws (dire wolf or hybrid form).

action.name: Bite (Dire Wolf or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Claws (Dire Wolf or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Longsword (Humanoid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) slashing damage, or 15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Forgetfull Song (Humanoid form only)
entries: The loup garou plays a magical melody on an instrument. Every humanoid within 200 ft. of the loup garou that can hear the melody must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or be effected by {@spell Modify Memory}, loosing all memory of the loup garo that is not older than 24 hours. A target that successfully saves is immune to this loup garou's melody for the next 24 hours.

bonus.name: Change Shape
entries: The loup garou polymorphs into a Large wolf-humanoid hybrid, a Large dire wolf, or into a humanoid form. Its statistics, other than its size and speed, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

legendary.name: Swipe
entries: The loup garou makes one Claws attack (dire wolf or hybrid form only) or one Longsword attack (humanoid form only).

legendary.name: Mauling Pounce (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The loup garou moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks, and it can make one Claws attack (dire wolf or hybrid form only) or one Longsword attack (humanoid form only) against each creature it moves past.

legendary.name: Bite (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The loup garou changes into hybrid or dire wolf form and then makes one Bite attack.

Loup garou possess a strain of lycanthropy more virulent than that carried by common werewolves. Aside from being deadlier than their werewolf cousins, loup garou aggressively spread the plague of lycanthropy. Only through the death of a loup garou might those afflicted by it escape their curse.

entries.name: Loup Garou Lycanthropy
entries: A Humanoid who succumbs to a loup garou's lycanthropy becomes a werewolf. This form of lycanthropy can't be removed while the loup garou that inflicted the curse lives. See the {@i Monster Manual} for details on lycanthropy.

Once a loup garou is slain, a {@spell remove curse} spell cast during the night of a full moon on any afflicted werewolf it created forces the target to make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw. On a success, the curse is broken, and the target returns to its normal form and gains 3 levels of exhaustion. On a failure, the curse remains, and the target automatically fails any saving throw made to break this curse for 1 month.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The couatl's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring only verbal components:

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The couatl's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Shielded Mind
entries: The couatl is immune to scrying and to any effect that would sense its emotions, read its thoughts, or detect its location.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 24 hours. Until this poison ends, the target is {@condition unconscious}. Another creature can use an action to shake the target awake.

action.name: Constrict
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one Medium or smaller creature. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the couatl can't constrict another target.

action.name: Change Shape
entries: The couatl magically polymorphs into a humanoid or beast that has a challenge rating equal to or less than its own, or back into its true form. It reverts to its true form if it dies. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the couatl's choice).

In a new form, the couatl retains its game statistics and ability to speak, but its AC, movement modes, Strength, Dexterity, and other actions are replaced by those of the new form, and it gains any statistics and capabilities (except class features, legendary actions, and lair actions) that the new form has but that it lacks. If the new form has a bite attack, the couatl can use its bite in that form.
Couatls are benevolent serpentine beings of great intellect and insight. Their brilliantly colored wings and gentle manner speak to their celestial origins.

entries.name: Divine Caretakers
entries: Couatls were created as guardians and caretakers by a benevolent god not worshiped since the dawn of time, and which is forgotten now by all but the couatls themselves. Most of the divine mandates given to these beings are long since fulfilled or failed. However, a number of couatls still watch over ancient power, await fulfillment of prophecy, or safeguard the heirs of creatures they once guided and protected. Regardless of a couatl's task, it prefers to remain hidden, revealing itself only as a last resort. Truth Tellers. A couatl can't lie, but it can withhold information, answer questions vaguely, or allow others to jump to the wrong conclusions if doing so is necessary to protect something, to keep promises, or to hide the secret of its existence.

entries.name: Ancient and Few
entries: A couatl can live for ages without sustenance, even surviving without air, but these creatures can die of disease or the passage of time. A couatl can sense its end up to a century beforehand, but it has no insight into the manner of its demise. If a couatl has already accomplished what it set out to do, it accepts its fate. However, if its imminent death endangers the completion of its goals, it actively seeks out another couatl with which to produce offspring.

The mating ritual of couatls is a beautiful and elaborate dance of magic and light, which results in a gem-like egg from which a new couatl hatches. The parent that sought out the mate raises the newborn couatl and instructs it as to its duties, so that it can complete whatever task the parent leaves unfinished.

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The wraith can move through other creatures and objects as if they were {@quickref difficult terrain||3}. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the wraith has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Life Drain
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}21 ({@damage 4d8 + 3}) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Eternal Servitude
entries: The wraith targets a humanoid or undead within 10 feet of it that has been dead for no longer than 1 minute and died violently. The target's spirit rises as a {@creature specter} in the space of its corpse or in the nearest unoccupied space. The {@creature specter} is under the wraith's control. The wraith can have no more than seven specters under its control at one time.

bonus.name: To Position!
entries: The wraith shouts commands to up to two creatures that can heat it. The creatures can use their reaction to move up to their movement speed.

A wraith is malice incarnate, concentrated into an incorporeal form that seeks to quench all life. The creature is suffused with negative energy, and its mere passage through the world leaves nearby plants blackened and withered. Animals flee from its presence. Even small fires can be extinguished by the sucking oblivion of the wraith's horrifying existence.

entries.name: Vile Oblivion
entries: When a mortal humanoid lives a debased life or enters into a fiendish pact, it consigns its soul to eternal damnation in the Lower Planes. However, sometimes the soul becomes so suffused with negative energy that it collapses in on itself and ceases to exist the instant before it can shuffle off to some horrible afterlife. When this occurs, the spirit becomes a soulless wraith-a malevolent void trapped on the plane where it died. Almost nothing of the wraith's former existence is preserved; in this new form, it exists only to annihilate other life.

entries.name: Bereft of Body
entries: A wraith can move through solid creatures and objects as easily as a mortal creature moves through fog.

A wraith might retain a few memories of its mortal life as shadowy echoes. However, even the strongest events and emotions become little more than faint impressions, fleeting as half-remembered dreams. A wraith might pause to stare at something that fascinated it in life, or it might curb its wrath in acknowledgment of a past friendship. Such moments come rarely, however, because most wraiths despise what they were as a reminder of what they have become.

entries.name: Undead Commanders
entries: A wraith can make an undead servant from the spirit of a humanoid creature that has recently suffered a violent death. Such a fragment of woe becomes a specter, spiteful of all that lives.

Wraiths sometimes rule the legions of the dead, plotting the doom of living creatures. When they emerge from their tombs to do battle, life and hope shrivel before them. Even if a wraith's armies are forced to retreat, the lands its forces occupied are so blasted and withered that those who live there often starve and die.

entries.name: Undead Nature
entries: A wraith doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Echolocation
entries: The bat can't use its blindsight while {@condition deafened}.

trait.name: Keen Hearing
entries: The bat has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Judas can make a Claw and a Bite attack if he is flying or {@condition prone}

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage, and Judas can attempt to grapple the target if it is the same or smaller size than him.

action.name: Wing Attack
entries: Judas beats his wings. Each creature within 10 feet of the bat must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or take 9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. Judas can then fly up to half his flying speed.

action.name: Screech (1/short rest)
entries: Judas lets out a deafening screech. All creature in a 15ft. long cone must make a Constitution saving throw {@dc 16} or take 18 ({@damage 5d6}) thunder damage, or half as much on a successful one. If it fails by 5 or more it becomes {@condition stunned} until the end of Judas' next turn.

monster.name: Katarina
languages: The languages it knew in life

trait.name: Cruel Combatant
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage and an extra 4 ({@damage 1d8}) necrotic damage when the vampire patrician hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Misty Escape
entries: When it drops to 0 hp outside its resting place, the vampire patrician transforms into a cloud of mist instead of falling {@condition unconscious}, provided that it isn't in sunlight or running water. If it can't transform, it is destroyed. While it has 0 hp in mist form, it can't revert to its vampire form, and it must reach its resting place within 2 hours or be destroyed.

While in mist form it can't take any actions, speak, or manipulate objects. It is weightless, has a flying speed of 20 feet, can hover, and can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. In addition, if air can pass through a space, the mist can do so without squeezing, and it can't pass through water. It has advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws, and it is immune to all nonmagical damage, except the damage it takes from sunlight.
Once in its resting place, it reverts to vampire form. It is then {@condition paralyzed} until it regains at least 1 hp. After spending 1 hour in its resting place with 0 hp, it regains 1 hp.

trait.name: Noble Resilience (Recharges After A Long Rest)
entries: The vampire patrician can ignore the effects of sunlight for up to 1 minute.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The patrician regains 15 hp at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hp and isn't in sunlight or running water. If it takes radiant damage or damage from holy water, this trait doesn't function at the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The vampire patrician can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Vampire Weaknesses
entries: The vampire patrician has the following flaws.
Forbiddance - The patrician can't enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants.
Harmed by Running Water - The patrician takes 20 acid damage if it ends its turn in running water.

Stake to the Heart - If a piercing weapon made of wood is driven into the patrician's heart while the patrician is {@condition incapacitated} in its resting place, the patrician is {@condition paralyzed} until the stake is removed.
Sunlight Hypersensitivity - The patrician takes 20 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: If the vampire isn't in sunlight or running water, it can use its action to polymorph into a Tiny bat or a Medium cloud of mist, or back into its true form.

While in bat form, the vampire can't speak, its walking speed is 5 feet, and it has a flying speed of 30 feet. Its statistics, other than its size and speed, are unchanged. Anything it is wearing transforms with it, but nothing it is carrying does. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

While in mist form, the vampire can't take any actions, speak, or manipulate objects. It is weightless, has a flying speed of 20 feet, can hover, and can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. In addition, if air can pass through a space, the mist can do so without squeezing, and it can't pass through water. It has advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws, and it is immune to all nonmagical damage, except the damage it takes from sunlight.

trait.name: Nimble Escape
entries: Katarina can take the {@action Disengage} or {@action Hide} action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

trait.name: Sneak Attack
entries: Once per turn, Katarina deals an extra 14 ({@damage 4d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the katarina that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the katarina doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If Katarina is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the Katarina instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The vampire patrician makes two attacks, only one of which can be a bite attack.

action.name: Impaling Rapier +1
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) slashing damage, plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) necrotic damage. The vampiric knight impales the target on its longsword, grappling the target if it is a Medium or smaller creature (escape {@dc 16}). Until the grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns, and the vampire patrician can't make rapier attacks against other targets but his rapier attacks have advantage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one willing creature, or a creature that is {@condition grappled} by the vampire patrician, {@condition incapacitated}, or {@condition restrained}. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage. The target's hp maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the patrician regains hp equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hp maximum to 0. A humanoid slain in this way and then buried in the ground rises the following night as a vampire spawn under the vampire patrician's control.

action.name: Release the Hounds! (1/Day)
entries: The vampire patrician calls {@dice 2d4} hunting hounds (use {@creature mastiff} statistics) to its side. While outdoors, the vampire patrician can call {@dice 2d4} carrion ravens (use {@creature blood hawk} statistics) instead or {@dice 1d4} {@creature giant bat}. These creatures arrive in {@dice 1d4} rounds, helping the patrician and obeying its spoken commands. The beasts remain for 1 hour, until the patrician dies, or until the patrician dismisses them as a bonus action.

{@i Handsome and youthful-looking with blond hair, slightly pointed ears, and piercing blue eyes, this vampire has a definite air of arrogance as he regards everything around him with barely concealed contempt. }
Vampire patricians are weaker than their vampire kin but are far superior to the spawn their kin create. What they lack in power, they more than make up for in sheer cruelty.

entries.name: Iron-Fisted Rulers
entries: Vampire patricians govern a small town or village for their undead overlord. Seeking to impress those above them, they keep the downtrodden peasantry in a state of perpetual dread with public floggings, executions, and sacrifices on the altars of the Blood Goddess and hunting expeditions in which the patrician and guests pursue hapless peasants through the woods.

entries.name: Brooding Presence
entries: Vampire patricians make their homes in small castles or large manor houses, often on a steep hill that looms over their territory. Their subterranean resting places are well guarded by vampire spawn and mindless undead. The area around a vampire patrician's home is partially corrupted by its unnatural presence, creating the following effects: plants within 1,000 feet of its home warp to become more beautiful and deadly versions of their base form, secreting poison or releasing sweet-smelling, toxic pollen; and sounds are more muted, making conversation harder to overhear and screams for help almost inaudible over distances.

entries.name: Undead Nature
entries: The vampire patrician doesn't require air.

entries.name: Vampires in Midgard
entries: Vampires rule the Blood Kingdom of Morgau openly, treating the living as cattle to be bought, sold, exploited, and drained of blood by their undead masters. King Lucan reigns supreme in Morgau. His sworn nobles and vampire progeny are the princes, princesses, dukes, and duchesses beneath him, all vampires of great power in their own right. The counts and countesses, who hold smaller territories or powerful monasteries for the King, rank slightly lower than the princes and duchesses. Generals and governors, vampires who command Morgau's troops or rule smaller fiefdoms, sit beneath the counts and countesses.

Vampire patricians rank lowest among the vampire nobility and make up the majority of the lesser nobles, barons, lords, and ladies of the Blood Kingdom—still quite dangerous, and easily able to command darakhul, vampiric knights, and other servants.

Vampire priestesses stand somewhat outside of the ranking of vampires in the Blood Kingdom, due to their association with the Blood Goddess' faith. Once a vampire joins the Red Sisters, she is bound to the Blood Goddess, but she is also afforded extra respect and status in Morgau, regardless of her sire or original place in the hierarchy.

King Lucan and his court are the very first northern shroud-eaters and remain some of the strongest to this day. In the Southlands, shroud-eaters dwell within the Grand Necropolis of Siwal, and many inhabit an island known as the Pallid Court of Vampires within the Nurian city of Per-Bastet.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Lady Moonfire is a 5th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). She regains her expended spell slots when she finishes a short or long rest. She knows the following warlock spells:

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Lady Moonfire wears and a {@item Ring of Protection}, and carries a {@item Deck of Several Things|LLK}

trait.name: Fey Presence (Recharges after a Short Rest)
entries: Lady Moonfire can cause each creature within 10 feet of her to succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} by her (Mary's choice) until the end of her next turn.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: Lady Moonfire has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put her to sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Lady Moonfire can make two attacks.

action.name: Eldrich Blast
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 150/150 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) force damage.
